sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.core.services.resources

Interface ResourceProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Nameable, Provider
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DebugResourceProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractResourceProvider, DebugResourceProviderProxy, ForwardingResourceProvider

    public interface ResourceProvider
extends Provider
    An object responsible for providing Resource instances.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pavol Zbell

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ResourceProvider.Builder
      A builder for creating resource provider instances.

        getName

    • Method Detail

      • forName

        Resource<?> forName(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a resource with the specified name.

        This method is guaranteed to return the same resource instance for the specified resource name every time it is invoked.

        Parameters:
        name - the resource name, not an empty string or null
        Returns:
        the resulting Resource object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified resource name is an empty string
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified resource name is null
        ResourceNotFoundException - if no definition of the resource could be found by the specified name
        IllegalResourceClassException - if the resource implementation class is invalid
        ResourceInstantiationException - if the resource instantiation failed

      • forType

        <L extends Listener> java.util.Set<Resource<L>> forType(java.lang.Class<L> type)
        Returns a set of resources supporting the specified listener type.
        Parameters:
        type - the listener type, not null
        Returns:
        a set of resources supporting the specified listener type
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified listener type is null
        ResourceNotFoundException - if no definition of the resource could be found by the specified name
        IllegalResourceClassException - if the resource implementation class is invalid
        ResourceInstantiationException - if the resource instantiation failed

      • names

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> names()
        Returns names of all provided resources.

      • types

        java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends Listener>> types()
        Returns listener types supported by provided resources.

      • parent

        ResourceProvider parent()
        Returns the resource provider's parent or null if there is no parent. Standard implementations should return system resource provider if there is no direct parent (only the system resource provider returns null as it is at the top of the resource provider hierarchy).
        Specified by:
        parent in interface Provider
        See Also:
        ResourceProviders.getSystemProvider()

      • equals

        boolean equals(@Nullable
             java.lang.Object o)
        Compares the specified object with this provider for equality. Returns true if the specified object is also provider and the two providers have the same name. This definition ensures that this method works properly across different implementations of the provider interface.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface Provider
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - an object to be compared for equality with this provider
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is equal to this provider, false otherwise

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code value for this provider. The hash code of a provider should be equivalent to the hash code of the provider's name.
        Specified by:
        hashCode in interface Provider
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the hash code value for this provider
